description: [World Bank] Accra -- new World Bank report released today, calls for urgent action to strengthen the resilience of Ghana's health system against the adverse effects of climate change. The report, titled Climate and Health Vulnerability Assessment (CHVA) for Ghana, identifies gaps and risks to the country's health sector, while recommending policy actions and providing valuable insights into capacity to adapt to climate related shocks.
title: Africa: New World Bank Report Calls for Strengthening Resilience of Ghana's Health System in Response to Climate Change

description: [Daily Trust] Lafarge Africa Plc., a leading innovative and sustainable building solutions company, has launched an innovative and first of its kind water resistant cement in Nigeria called "Watershield'.
title: Africa: Lafarge Africa Unveils Watershield Cement to Boost Construction

description: [Africa CDC] The goal of the African Vaccination Week is simple yet profound: The week focuses on emphasizing the importance of protecting every person's right (particularly every child, woman and entire community) from vaccine-preventable diseases by strengthening immunization programs across the African Region.
title: Africa: Statement By H.E Dr. Jean Kaseya, Director General of Africa CDC, On the African Vaccination Week

description: [ISS] ISS modelling shows that carbon taxing can have major benefits if all nations contribute based on their income status.
title: Africa: Global Carbon Tax Urgently Needed to Manage the Climate Crisis

description: [UN News] Top UN officials called on Monday for swift action to combat the El Niño extreme weather events that are currently devastating southern Africa and other regions with flooding and drought.
title: Africa: UN Officials Urge Swift Action to Tackle El Niño-Induced Extreme Weather

description: [SciDev.Net] This article was produced with the support of the International Network for Governmental Science Advice (INGSA).
title: Africa: Q&amp;a - Bridging the Gap Between Science and Policymaking

description: [World Bank] The Zimbabwe Gender-Based Violence Assessment and the Gender Assessment show that the country has made progress but there are further actions that can be taken to address gender disparities.
title: Africa: Persistent Gender Disparities Hinder Women's Safety and Productivity in Zimbabwe

description: [HRW] We all have an interest in supporting people who are pressing governments to meet their obligations on climate change, whether they are protesting in the street, bringing cases to court, or even carrying out civil disobedience.
title: Africa: Environment Defenders Face New Wave of Oppression

description: [The Conversation Africa] Armed troops in Niger overthrew the government in July 2023, seizing power for themselves. The following months were rife with speculation that the military government would align with Moscow and possibly form ties with the Russian military or its associates.
title: West Africa: Russia Has Tightened Its Hold Over the Sahel Region - and Now It's Looking to Africa's West Coast

description: [The Conversation Africa] The conflict in Sudan has turned attention to a rarely discussed commodity: gum arabic. This product, the dried sap of certain species of acacia trees, is used mainly as an additive in the soft drinks industry. Sudan accounts for about 70% of global gum arabic exports. Asgar Ali, an expert in sustainable food systems, answers questions about the commodity and its prospects.
title: West Africa: Gum Arabic From Africa's Acacia Trees in the Sahel Is Used in Hundreds of Products - What's Worth Knowing

description: [IPS] Nairobi -- The World Health Organization's African regional office and partners published over 25 peer-reviewed articles in scientific journals in 2023 as part of efforts to address the imbalance in global research and ensure that Africa was better represented in the production of health research academic literature, a new report shows.
title: Africa: Who Africa Advances African Science By Promoting Peer-Reviewed Research

description: [The Conversation Africa] Social media apps regularly present teens with algorithmically selected content often described as "for you," suggesting, by implication, that the curated content is not just "for you" but also "about you" - a mirror reflecting important signals about the person you are.
title: Africa: Teens See Social Media Algorithms As Accurate Reflections of Themselves, Study Finds

description: [African Arguments] Regional price distortions hurt small traders the most; as more states adopt competition rules, it's the traders and consumers who will win big.
title: Africa: How Continental Competition Policy Strengthens the African Marketplace
